image.altText: A farmer in a field with cows.

props.synopsis: When farmer Matt Tack saw a video of his livestock being abused inside a Tasmanian abattoir, it was gut-wrenching — but when he raised his concerns with the facility "all we got was why these animal rights activists were horrible people".

title.children: Farmer shocked by seeing own animals abused in abattoir vision speaks, as industry warns of consequences if meatworks is shut down

image.altText: An Indigenous climate activist from India holds a banner reading: End fossil fuel. Save our planet and our future.

props.synopsis: Leaders from countries in favour of a fossil fuel phase-out, including Australia’s Pacific neighbours, are left stunned as the COP28 draft agreement omits any mention of the policy.

title.children: COP28 draft agreement omits plan to phase out fossil fuels, angering Pacific leaders

image.altText: Rachel Wake during climbing adventure.

props.synopsis: A man's guilty plea over the murder of his ex-wife on Christmas Day brings relief to the family, nearly two years since her death.

title.children: 'He changed his plea!': Family relief after man tells judge 'I'm guilty' of Christmas Day murder

image.altText: A portrait of a farmer looking at the camera, leaning on a car.

props.synopsis: Can sheep and solar panels mix? This farmer believes they can, and is now a step closer to realising his dream of over 600,000 panels on his Tasmanian farm.

title.children: 'It's a win-win': Solar to help the world — plus, the sheep can shelter under the panels

image.altText: A map shows a cyclone approaching Queensland.

props.synopsis: The weather system weakened to a category one over the weekend but could redevelop into a category two as it moves towards the Queensland coast.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper is expected to intensify again today

image.altText: Professor Igor Koralnik assists a long COVID patient.

props.synopsis: Internationally, countries like the US are scaling up efforts to address long COVID but Australia continues to close its specialist clinics. Medical professionals in Australia and overseas say it's a move that needs an urgent rethink.

title.children: Long COVID cases will likely increase with each new wave, so why are we closing clinics?

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: It is not surprising that a population surge that's contributing to higher rents and house prices has created heated political debate. Cutting net migration might help ease pressure, writes Nassim Khadem.

title.children: A population surge has contributed to higher rents and house prices, but will the fall in net migration fix it?

image.altText: A woman walks down the aisle of a chemist

props.synopsis: After months of speculation, the retail pharmacy juggernaut that is Chemist Warehouse will merge with Sigma Healthcare to create the biggest pharmacy company in Australia. Here's how the deal came to fruition, and what it means for their hundreds of stores.

title.children: Chemist Warehouse may be a discount pharmacy, but it's agreed to a merger worth $8.8 billion

image.altText: steven miles leaning to look over shannon fentiman's shoulder

props.synopsis: Three days before Ms Palaszczuk is due to step down, two members of the party's left — Deputy Premier Steven Miles and Health Minister Shannon Fentiman — have put in bids for the Labor leadership.

title.children: 'This could turn ugly': Labor in talks to avoid two-way leadership contest to replace Queensland premier

image.altText: A head and shoulders shpot of Christian Porter in a suit and tie outside.

props.synopsis: Oligarch Oleg Deripaska is fighting to overturn a ban imposed by Australia over his alleged "close ties" to Vladimir Putin amid the invasion of Ukraine.

title.children: Christian Porter representing Russian billionaire fighting to overturn Australian sanctions

image.altText: A man looks to his left as he buttons his suit jacket

props.synopsis: A judge in London orders Prince Harry to pay nearly $95,000 in legal fees to the publisher of The Daily Mail tabloid for his failed court challenge in a libel lawsuit.

title.children: Prince Harry ordered to pay $95,000 to British newspaper after court ruling

image.altText: A composite image of Sarah Snook in Succession, Margot Robbie as Barbie and Cillian Murphy in Oppenheimer.

props.synopsis: The nominees for the 2024 Golden Globe awards have been announced with Barbie and Succession both receiving multiple nominations.

title.children: Succession and Barbie dominate Golden Globes nominations

image.altText: Construction workers in the Rozelle interchange tunnel

props.synopsis: Infrastructure Australia's annual market capacity report reveals there are only 177,000 workers currently in the system, despite there being enough demand for the equivalent of 405,000 workers.

title.children: Massive workforce shortage threatens hundreds of billions of dollars in infrastructure investment

image.altText: A graphic showing two groups of children in school uniforms, one is standing on top of some coins

props.synopsis: Public schools must be fully funded to combat inequality and all students should be regularly screened to see if they need additional support, a major review into school resourcing has found.

title.children: 'Urgent action' needed to fix school funding inequality, major review finds

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a row of COVID-19 vaccines against a blue background.

props.synopsis: New COVID booster shots are now available in Australia. So who should get one, and will it protect against the virus in time for Christmas?

title.children: What you need to know about the new 'Kraken' COVID vaccine in Australia

image.altText: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is seen on a screen via video link from a penal colony.

props.synopsis: Navalny aides have been preparing for his expected transfer to a "special regime" colony, the harshest grade in Russia's prison system, after he was sentenced in August to an additional 19 years in prison.

title.children: As Putin confirms election push his biggest rival has once again gone missing

image.altText: Composite image of three people standing in front of mural that reads 'Tara'

props.synopsis: Residents say they live in friendly and resilient communities that should not be defined by the fatal shootings that rocked the nation a year ago.

title.children: How the small communities of Tara and Wieambilla want to be known a year after tragic murders

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair and a half smile, wearing an orange top, sits at a table

props.synopsis: When the Stella Prize-winning author was diagnosed with breast cancer at the same time as her sisters, her life — and writing — changed forever.

title.children: Charlotte Wood had just finished the draft of her novel when she received 'deeply shocking' news

image.altText: A chinese man at a graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Before he became the legendary Mao's Last Dancer, Li Cunxin was a peasant boy in communist China with a burning desire to work harder than everyone else.

title.children: 'Work harder than everyone else': Mao's Last Dancer gives his parting words of wisdom on eve of retirement

image.altText: A police officer stands in a large living room. People whose faces are blurred sit on couches.

props.synopsis: Dozens of extra officers have been deployed to the North Queensland city after a shocking spate of crimes, mostly committed by minors, that residents say have left them traumatised.

title.children: Townsville reeling after week-long crime wave of ram raids, car thefts and attacks on police

image.altText: Greta Donaldson wearing a hot pink apron standing in front of a brick wall, holding a large jar of peanut brittle.

props.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis is having a negative impact for smaller regional producers, where sales of food and wine usually ramp up ahead of the festive season.

title.children: Not so festive season for some small Victorian producers in the lead-up to Christmas

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt and black blazer leaves court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's mother, Kelly, tells Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial she noticed a marked change in her daughter around the time of the alleged rape, from having a joy of life to being left a "broken soul".

title.children: 'A mother's worst nightmare': Brittany Higgins's mother gives evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial

image.altText: A young man in a business short walks away from a court building, flanked by supporters.

props.synopsis: The stood-down Dragons player was armed with a hammer when he chased a tradesman onto a two-storey roof in a Wollongong suburb last year. The court heard he was urged on by his father, who has been jailed.

title.children: NRL player avoids jail over bone-crunching rooftop attack on tradesman

props.synopsis: Singer-songwriter Molly Rankin tells how The Hummingbirds inspired the group as they make their long-awaited return to Australia.

title.children: How an 80s Sydney band inspired Canadian indie pop darlings Alvvays

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a suit and blue tie standing with his arms spread apart with his mouth open

props.synopsis: Former US president Donald Trump says he has changed his mind about testifying in his own defence in a New York fraud case where he is accused of exaggerating the value of his real estate assets by billions of dollars to obtain more favourable bank loans and insurance terms.

title.children: Trump cancels plan to testify in New York fraud trial, saying he has 'nothing more to say'

image.altText: A man in blue PPE walking outside a hosue

props.synopsis: A woman and baby have been found dead inside a home in Perth's inner north, as major crime detectives investigate.

title.children: 'It just doesn't happen here': Locals shocked after woman and baby found dead in house

image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court hears a diabetic man whose car struck and killed five people outside a regional Victorian pub allegedly ignored nine warnings from a medical device that his blood glucose levels were low.

title.children: Driver in Daylesford pub crash had more than 30 previous traffic infringements, court hears

image.altText: a composite image of  Ben Roberts-Smith, left, and Kerry Stokes, Chairperson of Seven West Media

props.synopsis: Orders made in the Federal Court on Monday confirm Mr Stokes's private company, Australian Capital Equity Pty Ltd, will pay Nine's costs on an indemnity basis.

title.children: Kerry Stokes to pay Nine's court costs over Ben Roberts-Smith defamation trial

image.altText: Pedestrians walk past a poster promoting a candidate during Hong Kong election.

props.synopsis: The sharp slide in turnout since the last such election in 2019 comes after Beijing imposed a sweeping national security law that has been used to clamp down on dissent, and overhauled the electoral system to shut out democrats and other liberals.

title.children: 'Patriots only' election in Hong Kong draws record low voter turnout

image.altText: A group of women in colourful traditional Chinese ball gowns kneel in front of a row of pacific and chinese men in suits.

props.synopsis: Three Pacific ministers attend a high-level meeting on police cooperation between China and Pacific Island nations as Beijing continues its push to cement deeper security ties with the region.

title.children: Australia 'aware' of policy initiative as Beijing brings seven Pacific delegates to China for police talks

image.altText: Two people walk from a helicopter on a ship landing deck

props.synopsis: Vision shows the defence force evacuating four people from one of the world's most remote weather stations in the middle of the Coral Sea, which has found itself in the path of Cyclone Jasper.

title.children: Meteorologists on tiny remote island choppered to safety in emergency Cyclone Jasper evacuation

image.altText: Australian swimmer Emma McKeon adjusts her swimsuit before a race. She is wearing a cap and goggles.

props.synopsis: Australia's most decorated Olympian is ruled out of the Queensland swimming championships as she manages a torn muscle under her armpit.

title.children: Olympics injury setback for swim champ Emma McKeon

image.altText: Cuts of beef sit displayed in a butcher.

props.synopsis: Wealthy countries will need to cut the amount of red meat they eat if they're going to meet climate goals, according to a sustainable food roadmap launched at the UN climate summit in Dubai.

title.children: More chicken and veg, less cow to feed — and save — the world, says UN at climate summit

image.altText: Kellie stands in front of a blue ute

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support services say they are stretched to the brink and need more resources to keep up with "inventive" abusers who know how to work the system.

title.children: When Kellie's abusive husband died, she realised he'd given away their house and car

image.altText: To Muluwurri Magpies players embrace and celebrate.

props.synopsis: The rapid rise of Australian Rules Football continues on the Tiwi Islands, home to some of the sport's greatest names, as the inaugural grand final comes down to a thrilling finish.

title.children: 'Always been my dream': History made on Tiwi Islands after first women's footy grand final
